local_clues.quote: we're first starting off with regular squats 10 of each here we go in three two one let's go all the way down and up
local_clues.clue: The instructor initiates the squat session with regular squats, emphasizing full range of motion ('all the way down and up').

local_clues.quote: three two one let's go all the way down and up
local_clues.clue: Reiterates the form of the squat, emphasizing depth ('all the way down').

local_clues.quote: number three we're doing four jumps feet are going front and back one two three four down into a squat for ten
local_clues.clue: Instructions for foot placement and a change in position ('feet are going front and back') before going into the squat.

local_clues.quote: nice work next up sumo squats with a rise down and up here we go for ten
local_clues.clue: Introduction of a new variation, sumo squats with a rise, demonstrating different foot positioning and movement ('down and up').

local_clues.quote: all right next up squat with a twist coming down twisting squeezing that core
local_clues.clue: Details about the next squat variation, emphasizing a twist and core engagement ('coming down twisting squeezing that core').

global_clues.quote: today we have 10 different variations of squats we're going to do 10 reps per each variation
global_clues.clue: Mentions different squat variations to be covered in the video.
global_clues.relevance_to_segment: Provides context for the different squat types demonstrated in this segment.

global_clues.relevance_to_segment: Indicates the starting point and the type of squat to be demonstrated initially in this segment.

global_clues.quote: nice and easy next up double pulse squat so we're coming down pulse and up here we go
global_clues.clue: Another variation of squats shown, incorporating pulsing motion.
global_clues.relevance_to_segment: Demonstrates the different movements and techniques to be shown in this segment.

global_clues.quote: next up squat with a crunch coming down into a squat
global_clues.clue: Another variation involving a crunch, emphasizing the combination of movements.
global_clues.relevance_to_segment: Shows the integration of squats with additional moves to engage more muscle groups, as demonstrated in this segment of the video.

logical_inferences.description: Emphasis on Full Range of Motion
logical_inferences.details: Given the repeated emphasis on 'all the way down and up' in LC1 and LC2, it is clear that achieving full range of motion is a key focus in this segment. This indicates that proper depth in squats is being encouraged.

The segment includes multiple types of squats such as regular squats, double pulse squats, and sumo squats with a rise (as noted in LC1, LC2, and LC4), showcasing different techniques and foot positions which likely target various muscle groups.
The mention of core engagement during the twisting squat (LC5) suggests that maintaining core stability is an important aspect of the squat techniques demonstrated in this segment.
The structured move from one type of squat to another (360 degrees in LC1 to LC5) suggests a planned routine segmented by technique, designed to provide a comprehensive workout.

Recurrent instructions on pacing and maintaining count ('here we go in three, two, one' noted in GC2 and LC1) indicate that the instructor is focused on ensuring consistency and timing in each movement.

local_clues.quote: we're getting ready to go into round number two starting off with regular squats just breathe through it and tell yourself that you can do it here we go
local_clues.clue: Starting off the second round of squats with a motivational tone.

local_clues.quote: three two one let's go one two three all the way down
local_clues.clue: Same emphasis on achieving proper squat depth as seen in previous segment.

local_clues.quote: here we go push through three two one let's go down with a rise stretch those legs
local_clues.clue: Instructions for sumo squats with a rise, emphasizing stretching the legs.

local_clues.quote: good work all right moving on to our four jumps into a squat
local_clues.clue: Transition to a jumping squat variation, indicating a change in technique.

local_clues.quote: so you're bending and you're twisting and you're really squeezing that core squeezing this glute and stretching this leg here we go guys almost there
local_clues.clue: Instructions for squat with twists, emphasizing core and glute engagement along with leg stretch.

global_clues.quote: today we have 10 different variations of squats we're going to do 10 reps per each variation
global_clues.clue: Mentions different squat variations to be covered in the video.
global_clues.relevance_to_segment: Provides context for the various squat forms and repetitions included in this segment.

global_clues.quote: so if you're doing this at home and you're following along with me and you can't keep up with my pace that's totally okay
global_clues.clue: Encouragement for viewers doing this workout at home, suggesting modification if necessary.
global_clues.relevance_to_segment: This speaks to the pacing and acknowledging viewers' various fitness levels, reflecting a supportive approach throughout the segment.

global_clues.quote: we're getting ready to go into round number two starting off with regular squats
global_clues.clue: Announces the beginning of the second round of exercises and details on what it includes.
global_clues.relevance_to_segment: Sets the stage for the second half of the workout, tying in with the first squat variation mentioned in this segment.

global_clues.quote: take some deep breaths tell yourself you can do it your legs are capable of doing this it's your mind telling you that you can't
global_clues.clue: Motivational instruction encouraging mental fortitude along with physical effort.
global_clues.relevance_to_segment: This reinforces the mental endurance needed for the physical challenges shown in this segment.

logical_inferences.details: Beginning with regular squats again (LC1, GC3) and the inclusion of sumo squats with a rise (LC3) suggests a reinforcement of foundational techniques covered earlier but with added motivational guidance (GC2, GC4).
Repeated motivational phrases (GC2, GC4) throughout this segment indicate that mental perseverance is a crucial element considered as part of performing these squats correctly.
Consistent reminders to maintain depth ('all the way down' LC2) and engagement ('squeezing that core' LC5) suggest a strong emphasis on proper form and technique.

Multiple squat variations (jumping squats, twisting squats, sumo squats with a rise as shown in LC3, LC4, LC5) are incorporated, indicating a strategy to target different muscle groups and add variety.

The instructor's encouraging tone (GC2) and methodical guidance through different squat types (LC1-LC5) suggest a supportive instructional style aimed at ensuring thorough understanding and correct execution of each technique.

local_clues.quote: moving on to our curtsy lunges or squats so one leg's behind you doing 10 on either leg
local_clues.clue: Instructions for performing curtsy lunges or squats, highlighting leg positioning.

local_clues.quote: three two one let's go all the way down and opposite into this heel
local_clues.clue: Emphasis on depth and heel engagement during curtsy lunges.

local_clues.quote: good work switching sides here we go for ten
local_clues.clue: Highlights the transition and repetition for the other leg.
Emphasizes proper form by guiding to 'sit into that heel'.

local_clues.quote: last 10 squats but they are squat jumps i want you to not give up as long as it takes you to do 10 squat jumps you are going to do them
local_clues.clue: Endurance challenge with squat jumps, encouraging persistence.

global_clues.quote: today we have 10 different variations of squats we're going to do 10 reps per each variation
global_clues.clue: Mentions different squat variations to be covered in the video.
global_clues.relevance_to_segment: Provides context for including curtsy lunges and squat jumps in this segment.

global_clues.clue: Focus on technique for heel engagement during curtsy lunges.
global_clues.relevance_to_segment: Reiterates the importance of proper form and target muscle engagement in this segment.

global_clues.quote: i want you to not give up as long as it takes you to do 10 squat jumps
global_clues.clue: Encouragement to persist through the exercise regardless of time taken.
global_clues.relevance_to_segment: Highlights the mental aspect of the workout, advocating perseverance which is crucial during challenging exercises demonstrated here.

global_clues.quote: we're gonna take a little bit of a breather here and then we're gonna go into round number two
global_clues.clue: Suggests a structured workout plan with breaks in between sets or rounds.
global_clues.relevance_to_segment: Offers background on the workout structure, allowing viewers to understand the segment's place within the larger workout plan.

logical_inferences.details: Frequent reminders to 'sit into that heel' (LC2, LC4) indicate a focus on ensuring proper engagement of target muscles, particularly in curtsy lunges.
Transitional instructions (LC3) and the introduction of squat jumps (LC5) reveal a structured progression in the workout, moving from isolated muscle engagement to full body explosive movements.
The motivational emphasis on not giving up during squat jumps (LC5, GC3) suggests a focus on building endurance and encouraging persistence through difficult exercises.
Consistent cues for depth and heel engagement during curtsy lunges (LC2, LC4) reiterate the importance of maintaining proper form throughout the exercises.
The segment appears to be the closing part of the workout, emphasizing a final push through challenging squat jumps and reflecting completion of the squat variations covered in the video.
